programme.title: High Life, (2018, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Monte and his baby daughter are the last survivors of a damned and dangerous mission to the outer reaches of the solar system. They must now rely on each other to survive as they hurtle toward the oblivion of a black hole.

programme.title: A Cure for Wellness, (2016, Thriller)
programme.desc: After traveling to a remote location in the Swiss Alps, a Wall Street stockbroker (Dane DeHaan) unravels the terrifying secrets of a mysterious spa where guests never leave.

programme.title: Mississippi Masala, (1991, Comedy)
programme.desc: People resent the romance of a black man (Denzel Washington) and an Indian woman (Sarita Choudhury) in a Mississippi town.

programme.title: Superman/Batman: Public Enemies, (2009, Animated)
programme.desc: Superman (Tim Daly) and Batman join forces to save the world from Lex Luthor's (Clancy Brown) evil plot.

programme.title: Mortdecai, (2015, Comedy)
programme.desc: Armed with only his good looks and special charm, an art dealer (Johnny Depp) travels the world to find a stolen painting that is rumored to contain the code to a bank account filled with Nazi gold.

programme.title: Night on Earth, (1992, Drama)
programme.desc: Five brief encounters occur in five taxis on the same night in Los Angeles, New York, Rome, Paris and Helsinki.

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax, (2016, Thriller)
programme.desc: An acclaimed neurologist (Jamie Dornan) taps into the unconscious mind of a 9-year-old boy (Aiden Longworth) who has survived nine near-death accidents.

programme.title: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me, (1992, Crime Story)
programme.desc: Agent Cooper (Kyle MacLachlan) comes to Twin Peaks, Wash., following two unresolved murders and the disappearance of two fellow agents.

programme.title: My Cousin Rachel, (2017, Drama)
programme.desc: Philip is a young Englishman who falls under the spell of a beautiful but manipulative woman named Rachel. As his obsession for her grows, she hatches a scheme to win back her late husband's estate from the unsuspecting Philip.

programme.title: Accidentally Brave
programme.desc: With unexpected humor, Maddie Corman shares a story of perseverance and hope in the face of crisis.

programme.title: Reframed: Next Gen Narratives
programme.desc: In this series, six filmmakers adapt classic movies through a contemporary lens, tackling modern-day issues surrounding identity.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: Sigsby tricks Luke into confirming he's TP, forcing him to move up his escape attempt; Tim's suspicions put him on the Institute's radar.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: As Tim's investigation pays off in ways he never imagined and Sigsby scrambles to avert disaster, Luke must finally decide who he can trust.

programme.title: Beauty Shop, (2005, Comedy)
programme.desc: After a falling-out with an overbearing employer, reputed hairstylist Gina decides to go independent. Soon enough, she opens the doors of her new salon to an amusing crowd of patrons.

programme.title: The Cutting Edge, (1992, Romance)
programme.desc: An ex-hockey player (D.B. Sweeney) and a prima donna (Moira Kelly) bicker as paired figure skaters shooting for the Olympics.

programme.title: Agent Cody Banks, (2003, Children)
programme.desc: Recruited by the CIA, a teen works under cover to befriend a girl whose father unknowingly works for an evil organization.

programme.title: Desperately Seeking Susan, (1985, Comedy)
programme.desc: A bored housewife (Rosanna Arquette) with amnesia thinks she is "Susan," a wild woman (Madonna) on the run.

programme.title: Sabrina, (1995, Romance)
programme.desc: Sons (Harrison Ford, Greg Kinnear) of a Long Island tycoon become romantic rivals for the chauffeur's daughter (Julia Ormond).

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral, (1994, Romance)
programme.desc: An English charmer (Hugh Grant) and a lusty American (Andie MacDowell) make love over a course of surprising events.

programme.title: Moonstruck, (1987, Romance)
programme.desc: An Italian-American widow (Cher), engaged to a reticent suitor, falls in love with his brother (Nicolas Cage).

programme.title: Legally Blonde, (2001, Comedy)
programme.desc: A sorority queen (Reese Witherspoon) enrolls in Harvard to prove to her former boyfriend that she has more than good looks.

programme.title: Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde, (2003, Comedy)
programme.desc: Fired from her firm, a young Boston lawyer (Reese Witherspoon) heads to Washington, D.C., to fight for animal rights.

programme.title: Serendipity, (2001, Romance)
programme.desc: A man (John Cusack) and a woman (Kate Beckinsale) try to find each other after spending one night together 10 years earlier.

programme.title: Mean Girls, (2024, Musical)
programme.desc: A new student gets welcomed into the top of the social food chain by an elite group of popular girls called the Plastics. However, when she makes the misstep of falling for the queen bee's ex-boyfriend, she finds herself caught in their crosshairs.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: As Tim's investigation pays off in ways he never imagined and Sigsby scrambles to avert disaster, Luke must finally decide who he can trust.

programme.title: Three Thousand Years of Longing, (2022, Fantasy)
programme.desc: While attending a conference in Istanbul, Dr. Alithea Binnie happens to encounter a djinn who offers her three wishes in exchange for his freedom. Eventually, she's beguiled and makes a wish that surprises them both.

programme.title: Our Kind of Traitor, (2016, Thriller)
programme.desc: A money launderer (Stellan Skarsgard) for Russian gangsters asks a couple vacationing in Marrakech, Morocco, to deliver incriminating evidence to an MI6 agent (Damian Lewis).

programme.title: The Portable Door, (2023, Fantasy)
programme.desc: A man lands an internship at a mysterious London firm with unconventional employees, including the charismatic CEO who is incorporating modern corporate strategy into ancient magical practices.

programme.title: The Living Daylights, (1987, Action)
programme.desc: Secret agent James Bond (Timothy Dalton) takes a Czech cellist (Maryam d'Abo) to her boyfriend, a KGB defector (Jeroen Krabb√©) doing business in Afghanistan.

programme.title: Dr. No, (1962, Action)
programme.desc: Agent 007 (Sean Connery) foils a SPECTRE madman (Joseph Wiseman) out to divert rockets from Cape Canaveral.

programme.title: Octopussy, (1983, Action)
programme.desc: Agent 007 (Roger Moore) links a fake Faberge egg to smugglers (Maud Adams, Louis Jourdan) in league with a mad Soviet general.

programme.title: From Russia With Love, (1963, Action)
programme.desc: Agent 007 arrives in Istanbul, bringing with him a Russian beauty who is an unwitting pawn in SPECTRE's plot to kill him.

programme.title: Live and Let Die, (1973, Action)
programme.desc: Agent 007 (Roger Moore) charms a tarot reader (Jane Seymour) in Jamaica on the voodoo/heroin trail of Mr. Big (Yaphet Kotto).

programme.title: GoldenEye, (1995, Action)
programme.desc: A secret weapon's theft sends Agent 007 to Russia, where a pretty computer programmer helps him track an ex-cohort believed dead.

programme.title: Casino Royale, (2006, Action)
programme.desc: After receiving a license to kill, British agent James Bond (Daniel Craig) enters a high-stakes poker game with Le Chiffre (Mads Mikkelsen), a man who finances terrorist groups.

programme.title: Die Another Day, (2002, Action)
programme.desc: James Bond (Pierce Brosnan) teams with a beautiful agent (Halle Berry) to battle a terrorist and a businessman (Toby Stephens) bent on world domination.

programme.title: Marathon Man, (1976, Thriller)
programme.desc: The CIA and a Nazi death-camp dentist (Laurence Olivier) chase a New York graduate student (Dustin Hoffman).

programme.title: LaRoy, Texas, (2023, Comedy)
programme.desc: Mistaken for a low-rent hit man, Ray decides to play the part of a hired gun. However, when the supposedly simple plan begins to unravel, he recruits a private investigator to help him escape from the actual killer and make it out alive.

programme.title: Agent Cody Banks 2: Destination London, (2004, Children)
programme.desc: A 16-year-old CIA agent (Frankie Muniz) poses as a clarinet prodigy while trying to recover stolen mind-control software.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: As Tim's investigation pays off in ways he never imagined and Sigsby scrambles to avert disaster, Luke must finally decide who he can trust.

programme.title: Nobody's Fool, (1994, Drama)
programme.desc: An aging irresponsible misfit (Paul Newman) falls in love with an unhappily married younger woman (Melanie Griffith).

programme.title: Missing in Action, (1984, War)
programme.desc: A U.S. colonel (Chuck Norris) escapes from the Viet Cong, then comes back with a floating arsenal to get others out.

programme.title: Species, (1995, Science fiction)
programme.desc: A scientist (Ben Kingsley) leads the hunt for a genetically engineered creature who morphs into a human blonde and tries to reproduce in Los Angeles.

programme.title: The Running Man, (1987, Science fiction)
programme.desc: A police-state scapegoat (Arnold Schwarzenegger) must play a TV host's (Richard Dawson) deadly game show for the 21st-century masses.

programme.title: xXx: Return of Xander Cage, (2017, Action)
programme.desc: Daredevil operative Xander Cage (Vin Diesel) springs into action when four dangerous criminals steal Pandora's Box, a device that controls every military satellite in the world.

programme.title: Casino Royale, (2006, Action)
programme.desc: After receiving a license to kill, British agent James Bond (Daniel Craig) enters a high-stakes poker game with Le Chiffre (Mads Mikkelsen), a man who finances terrorist groups.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: Luke and Tim go on a desperate search for help as Sigsby uses all of her formidable assets in a last-ditch attempt to keep the Institute's secrets.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: Luke and Tim go on a desperate search for help as Sigsby uses all of her formidable assets in a last-ditch attempt to keep the Institute's secrets.

programme.title: G.I. Joe: Retaliation, (2013, Action)
programme.desc: The G.I. Joes are not only fighting their mortal enemy Cobra, they are also forced to contend with threats from within the government that jeopardize their very existence.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: Luke and Tim go on a desperate search for help as Sigsby uses all of her formidable assets in a last-ditch attempt to keep the Institute's secrets.

programme.title: The Parallax View, (1974, Thriller)
programme.desc: A reporter's investigation into a political assassination reveals a nationwide network of trained killers.

programme.title: Suspect Zero, (2004, Thriller)
programme.desc: With help from his former partner (Carrie-Anne Moss), an FBI agent (Aaron Eckhart) searches for a man (Ben Kingsley) who is hunting and murdering serial killers.

programme.title: Intersection, (1994, Drama)
programme.desc: An architect (Richard Gere) on the brink of a car accident recalls troubles with his wife (Sharon Stone) and his mistress (Lolita Davidovich) in Vancouver, British Columbia.

programme.title: The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio, (2005, Drama)
programme.desc: A '50s-era housewife (Julianne Moore) uses her wit and winnings from commercial jingle contests to help support her large family.

programme.title: A Shot in the Dark, (1964, Comedy)
programme.desc: Clumsy Inspector Clouseau (Peter Sellers) visits a nudist camp to prove a French maid (Elke Sommer) innocent of murder.

programme.title: The Deep House, (2021, Horror)
programme.desc: While diving in a remote French lake, two YouTubers who specialize in underwater exploration videos discover a house submerged in deep waters. Their dive turns into a nightmare when they discover the house was the scene of atrocious crimes.

programme.title: The Passenger, (2023, Horror)
programme.desc: Randy is perfectly content to fade into the background, but when one of his co-workers goes on a sudden and violent rampage, he must face his fears and confront his troubled past to survive.

programme.title: There's Something Wrong With the Children, (2023, Drama)
programme.desc: Margaret and Ben take a weekend trip with two longtime friends and their two young children. Ben soon suspects something sinister is afoot when the kids start behaving strangely after disappearing into the woods overnight.

programme.title: Mimic, (1997, Horror)
programme.desc: Married scientists (Mira Sorvino, Jeremy Northam) battle killer cockroaches that develop the ability to assume human form.

programme.title: The Crow, (1994, Action)
programme.desc: A black bird resurrects a rock musician (Brandon Lee) who then avenges his own murder and his fiancee's.

programme.title: Event Horizon, (1997, Science fiction)
programme.desc: A spaceship missing for seven years finally re-emerges and sends out a distress signal. But when a team is sent out to investigate, they discover that something sinister has taken over the craft.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: Luke and Tim go on a desperate search for help as Sigsby uses all of her formidable assets in a last-ditch attempt to keep the Institute's secrets.

programme.title: Billy the Kid
programme.desc: Billy, on the move again, ends up in Chihuahua, Mexico, with a new Mexican friend called Segura; together they enjoy several risky escapades -- but in the end, Billy risks losing his life.

programme.title: Billy the Kid
programme.desc: Billy bumps into a new character called Pat Garrett, who is riding with Jesse and the 7 Rivers Gang; Billy joins them - but law makers are already closing in; they plan to flee to Lincoln County - but not before Billy fulfils one last promise.

programme.title: The Haunting, (1999, Horror)
programme.desc: A parapsychologist and three others stay in a house reputed to be the site of many awful tragedies and paranormal events.

programme.title: Rings, (2017, Horror)
programme.desc: A young woman (Matilda Lutz) makes a horrifying discovery after her boyfriend (Alex Roe) investigates a story about a mysterious video that kills people seven days after they watch it.

programme.title: Quigley Down Under, (1990, Western)
programme.desc: An Old West sharpshooter (Tom Selleck) goes to Australia, where his new boss (Alan Rickman) expects him to kill Aboriginal Australians.

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in the West, (1968, Western)
programme.desc: An outlaw (Henry Fonda) working for a railroad magnate fights a stranger (Charles Bronson) for a New Orleans widow's (Claudia Cardinale) land.

programme.title: The Krays, (1990, Crime Story)
programme.desc: Warped by their mother (Billie Whitelaw), cockney twins Ronald and Reginald Kray (Gary Kemp, Martin Kemp) become gangsters in 1950s London.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop, (1984, Comedy)
programme.desc: A freewheeling Detroit cop pursuing a murder investigation finds himself dealing with the very different culture of Beverly Hills.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop II, (1987, Comedy)
programme.desc: The hard-nosed Detroit cop returns to Los Angeles to help solve another case. This time he must direct his efforts towards unraveling the Alphabet Crimes, a series of robberies committed by leather-jacketed punks.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop III, (1994, Comedy)
programme.desc: A hip detective (Eddie Murphy) from Detroit tracks a crime ring to a Los Angeles fun park called WonderWorld.

programme.title: Atlantic City, (1980, Drama)
programme.desc: A boardwalk numbers runner (Burt Lancaster) feels young again with a casino clam shucker (Susan Sarandon) and a lucky cocaine deal.

programme.title: Thelma & Louise, (1991, Adventure)
programme.desc: An Arkansas waitress (Susan Sarandon) and a housewife (Geena Davis) shoot a rapist and take off in a '66 Thunderbird.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels, (2000, Action)
programme.desc: Three private detectives try to rescue a kidnapped computer pro whose voice-ID software would threaten global security.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle, (2003, Action)
programme.desc: Three private detectives (Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore, Lucy Liu) work under cover to retrieve two rings that contain cryptic information.

programme.title: Tropic Thunder, (2008, Comedy)
programme.desc: A pampered actor and his co-stars must become actual soldiers when the war movie they are filming in Southeast Asia turns into the real thing.

programme.title: Scary Movie, (2000, Comedy)
programme.desc: Keenen Ivory Wayans directed this sendup of slasher films in which a vengeful killer stalks a group of nubile teens.

programme.title: Thelma & Louise, (1991, Adventure)
programme.desc: An Arkansas waitress (Susan Sarandon) and a housewife (Geena Davis) shoot a rapist and take off in a '66 Thunderbird.

programme.title: El Dorado, (1966, Western)
programme.desc: An old gunfighter (John Wayne), a drifter (James Caan) and a deputy sober up a sheriff (Robert Mitchum) to track down killers.

programme.title: Three Wishes, (1995, Fantasy)

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The first to duel under the all-new Deck Master System is Yugi against Big 1 Gansley's Deepsea Warrior! Can Yugi master the complex new rules, or will the rules master him?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: As Yugi struggles to make heads or tails of the Deck Master System, Big 1 uses his Deck Master ability to send all of Yugi's attacks right back! How can Yugi defeat an opponent when his attacks take away his own life points?

programme.desc: Yugi's running out of life points, but can his cute little Deck Master Kuriboh unleash his furry fury to turn the tide of battle?

programme.desc: As T√©a's body turns more and more into a giant popsicle, can she keep her brain from freezing to find a way to melt Big 2's strategy? Or will Big 2's penguin horde waddle all over her?

programme.desc: Joey squares off against the judicial jerk Big 3 Johnson who takes the Deck Master form of Judge Man! How can Joey defeat a foe who can destroy Joey's monsters at will?

programme.desc: Just when Joey seems to gain the upper hand, he hits the longest streak of bad luck in the history of mankind! Has Joey's fortunes finally run out, or is a crooked judge ignoring the rules of the law?

programme.desc: Big 4 Nezbitt challenges Duke, Tristan, and Serenity for the right to gain control of three bodies at once! Will Serenity's errors cost her team the ultimate price when Tristan and Duke can't cover for her mistakes?

programme.desc: One down, two to go! With the loss of Tristan, Serenity is heartbroken. Can she pull herself together and remember the lessons Tristan taught her to turn the duel around?

programme.desc: Tristan's back... but he's not who he appears to be when he kidnaps Mokuba! It's time for Kaiba to stop monkeying around and rescue his brother, but he's confronted by Big 5 Leichter!

programme.desc: Big 5's Satellite Cannon attacks Kaiba's monsters from deep space! Mokuba's unwavering faith in Kaiba inspires him to believe that his brother will pull out the victory, but Noah has plans to ruin their brotherhood...

programme.desc: Kaiba arrives at Noah's sanctuary to rescue Mokuba, but Mokuba wants to stay with Noah! Has Mokuba seen the evil within Kaiba, or is something more sinister in the works?

programme.desc: For every turn that passes, one of Yugi's friends is transformed into stone! As more and more of his friends harden into solid rock, can Yugi defeat Noah before he runs out of turns and transforms into stone himself?

programme.desc: Yugi has defeated Noah... but they still can't escape from the virtual world! The real reason behind their entrapment is revealed... as is the true villain pulling the strings!

programme.desc: Joey may have fought some of the fiercest fights in Battle City, but has all his training taught him to become an elite duelist? Joey's gonna show what he's made of in the conclusion to the four-man battle royal!

programme.desc: Marik ensnares Joey in a Shadow Game where each duelist's heart is linked with his monsters... literally! Every time a monster received damage, the duelist feels the pain instead!

programme.desc: Marik's Helpoemer send Joey's powerful cards to the graveyard before Joey can use them! Running low on cards and life points, Joey's opportunities for staging a comeback are nearly depleted!

programme.title: Luffy continues training himself to use Haki with Old Man Hyo's help, but the battle is suddenly suspended and shortly thereafter Raizo appears in front of them. Meanwhile, Nami, Usopp, and the others are wondering who Tonoyasu really is.

programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Shaking the Nation! The Identity of Ushimitsu Kozo The Chivalrous Thief!

programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Straw Hats Run! Save the Captive Tonoyasu!

programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Zoro's Fury! The Truth About the Smile!

programme.desc: One Piece

programme.desc: One Piece

programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Stop the Emperor of the Sea! Queen's Secret Plan!

programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Brutal Ammunition! The Plague Rounds Aim at Luffy!

programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Start Fighting Back! Luffy and the Akazaya Samurai!

programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: We‚Äôre Here to Win! Luffy's Desperate Scream!

programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Warriors' Dream! Luffy's Conquer of Udon!

programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Orochi's Hunting Party! The Ninja Group vs. Zoro!

programme.title: Nami and Franky join Kanjuro who has taken Yasuie's dead body to bury him with Oden, and together they hit the road. Robin, Usopp, and Brook are at the dock trying to figure out a way to pass through a check point.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Tension Rises in Onigashima! Two Emperors of the Sea Meet?!

programme.title: As the clash between Kaido and Big Mom continues, Queen looks for a way to get out of Onigashima. Meanwhile in Udon, Old Man Hyo finds his former allies, four bosses from each region.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Hiyori's Confession! A Reunion at Bandit's Bridge!

programme.title: Zoro runs after the warrior-monk who took his Shusui and Kawamatsu shares with Hiyori his memory of a fox that was guarding the graves in Ringo. As they catch up to Zoro, they find a room filled with swords.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Its Name is Enma! Oden's Great Swords!

programme.title: As the day of the raid approaches, Law finds someone who might help him escape the prison and Kin'emon gathers up most of his main allies to discuss the raid plan. Meanwhile, at Onigashima, Kaido and Big Mom make a stunning declaration!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A New Alliance?! Kaido‚Äôs Army Gathers!

programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Ticking Down to the Great Battle! The Straw Hats Go into Combat Mode!

programme.title: The resolution that passed the Reverie and the incidents surrounding the conference stun people all over the world and corner the Seven Warlords of the Sea. Meanwhile, a Navy captain Koby secretly contacts someone who is currently in the Land of Wano.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Big News! An Incident That Will Affect the Seven Warlords!

programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Legendary Battle! Garp and Roger!

programme.title: On the day of the Fire Festival, Orochi leaves the mainland of the Land of Wano heading for Onigashima where a big banquet will take place.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Rendezvous Port! The Land of Wano Act Three Begins!

programme.title: The night before the great battle, Orochi orders the destruction of the Sunny along with some bridges across the country to block Akazaya samurai's allies from their rendezvous.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Number-One Samurai in the Land of Wano! Here comes Kozuki Oden!

programme.title: When the angry mountain god, the giant boar, almost kills Kin'emon, Oden steps in. Kin'emon is impressed when he sees Oden's strength and pledges his life to serve him.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Tearfully Swearing Allegiance! Oden and Kin'emon!

programme.title: Oden transforms the wild land of Kuri into a habitable region and is made Daimyo over it. Then he meets Kawamatsu the Kappa and the two Minks, Dogstorm and Cat Viper, who become his followers like the others.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Changing Destiny! The Whitebeard Pirates Cast Ashore!

programme.title: Whitebeard and his crew dock at one of the ports in the Land of Wano with their broken ship and the news excites Oden. He runs to the port and asks Whitebeard to let him get on board the ship but the request is rejected.
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Oden's journey finally begins. He is in awe of all the things that he has never seen before. And for the first time in his life, he becomes a wanted person and makes the headlines which catches the eye of a high-profile figure.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Whitebeard's Little Brother! Oden's Great Adventure!

programme.title: In the Land of Wano, the Shogun Sukiyaki falls critically ill and names Orochi proxy Shogun until Oden returns in case he dies.
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Roger is amazed when he finds out that Oden can read the script on the Ponegliff since he believes it will guide him to the last, undiscovered island where no man has ever been.
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Singing out loud, the Roger Pirates continue on with their journey. They soar up to the island above the clouds and go down into the deep sea to get to the island at the sea bottom.
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Oden and the Roger Pirates head for the Land of Wano to obtain a copy of the Road Ponegliff. Oden sees Kin'emon and the others for the first time in years, but he immediately returns to the sea leaving his wife and children behind.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The King of the Pirates is Born! Arriving at the Last Island!

programme.title: After reaching Laugh Tale, Roger declares the disbanding of his pirate group and disembarks first. Oden gets dropped off at the Land of Wano and reunites with his family and retainers.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: To the Land of Wano! The Roger Pirates Disband!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin learns he needs a pure-hearted girl to find an ancient Persian treasure and his computer chooses a girl named Lori. After getting some hands-on training from Jigen and Goemon, the two are headed to Jordan to find the treasure.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: The Golden Apple, known as "Eve's Apple" is being transported to New York City on board a luxury cruise ship and Inspector Zenigata has a gut feeling Lupin is after it. Inspector Zenigata's hunch is on the mark as Lupin and Jigen are onboard the ship.
programme.sub-title: A Golden Apple Has Its Poison

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin is over the moon when Fujiko promises to marry him if he steals the ICPO's gold for her. Lupin pulls off the heist right under Inspector Zenigata's nose, but the two soon find themselves locked up in jail.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: It's the Mafia Boss' birthday party and everyone is gambling away. Lupin's next target is the casino's safe. While attending the party, Lupin meets a girl named Jenny, who is willing to help him pull off the heist to sell her name.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin breaks out a man named Parker from a Mexican prison in order to steal the treasure Parker had hidden away somewhere.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3

programme.sub-title: The Man Who Erased His Past

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: An ancient burial mound has been discovered and etched on its walls are ancient mythical creatures with jewel-encrusted eyes. Lupin makes off with the blue dragon's crystal eye and kidnaps the archeologist in charge.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang break into a vault full of uncut diamonds. However, the diamonds suddenly catch on fire, and guess who is being blamed for it!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: The Swiss Bank's Beirut branch is a mobile branch. Will Lupin manage to pull off the heist of this impenetrable bank and get out safely with Inspector Zenigata on his tail?

programme.desc: Lupin and his gang are after Taniyama's treasure from an ancient Chinese dynasty. Realizing that Lupin is after his treasure, Taniyama hires a lone assassin named Seiryuu to counter Goemon.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang were pursuing Flight 107 when Soviet Union planes suddenly shoot it down for wandering into its territory inadvertently.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin is over the moon, now that he's won Fujiko's hand in marriage after stealing Marie Antoinette's wedding dress and ring.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: A massive amount of gold is being transported in the cover of darkness, but on this rainy night, Lupin is busy being a bartender to a beautiful woman named Sara.
